sentence.Network_en: He had the effrontery to say I was lying.
This is a despicable fraud . Just imagine that he has the effrontery to say it.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是一个可耻的骗局. 他竟然有脸说这样的话.

sentence.Network_en: One could only gasp at the sheer effrontery of the man.
sentence.Network_cn: 那人十足的厚颜无耻让人们吃惊得无话可说。

托福词汇英语学习-托福考试-考试大 ... effluent adj. 流出的 effrontery n. 厚颜无耻，放肆（的行为） effuse vt. 流出，散布.
不择手段背单词(十二）_小米_新浪博客 ... audacious 大胆的；卤莽的）" effrontery 厚颜无耻的行为）" intimidate 恐吓）【反】.

list.abs: He had the effrontery to say I was lying ., 他竟敢说我撒谎.
Why are you showing such effrontery ?, 你为什么表现的如此放肆?
the politician had the effrontery to ask the people he had insulted to vote for him .这个政客竟厚颜地要求受过他侮辱的人投他一票。
aggressive boldness or unmitigated effrontery ., 大胆好斗而且厚颜无耻.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French effronterie, based on late Latin effrons, effront- 'shameless, barefaced', from ex- 'out' + frons 'forehead'

entry.def: Effrontery is behaviour that is bold, rude, or disrespectful.

example.ex: One could only gasp at the sheer effrontery of the man.
example.tran: 那人十足的厚颜无耻让人们吃惊得无话可说。

means.word_mean: 1. audacious (even arrogant) behavior that you have no right to;

auth_sentence.content: This effrontery brought out Hulagu's sternest side.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: This effrontery brought out Hulagu's sternest side.

auth_sentence.content: First of all there is the barefaced effrontery of it all.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: First of all there is the barefaced effrontery of it all.

auth_sentence.content: The problem is the vocals, and the lyrics, and the general jaw-dropping effrontery of The Like.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The problem is the vocals, and the lyrics, and the general jaw-dropping effrontery of The Like.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能被说出的, 可表达的

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"行为,情况"; 2. 表名词,"场所,地点"

sentences.en: How can he have had the effrontery to say “Piss off!” to you?
sentences.cn: 他怎么会这样无耻，竟然对你“滚开！”呢？
